title: EJScreen (EPA)
description: The goal of EJScreen is to find places at the census block group level that could have greater environmental burdens, highlighting specific populations that may be at risk. The tool also allows users to obtain environmental and demographic information all over the U.S.A, at high spatial resolution, shown with color-coded maps and standard data reports.
creator: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
subject: Demographics
Employment
Health and Healthcare
Social and Community Context
Composite Index
methods_variables: Underground Storage Tanks (UST) and Leaking UST (LUST)
data_variables: Annual average PM2.5 levels in air
Average of the annual top ten daily maximum 8-hour ozone concentrations in air
Average annual nitrogen dioxide (NO2) levels expressed as part per billion (by volume)
Diesel particulate matter level in air
RSEI modeled toxicity-weighted concentrations in air of TRI listed chemicals
Count of vehicles (avg. annual daily traffic) at major roads within 500 meters, divided by distance (meters)
Percent of housing units built pre-1960, as indicator of potential lead paint exposure
Count of proposed or listed NPL (superfund) sites within 5 km (or nearest one within 10 km), each divided by distance (km)
Count of RMP facilities within 5 km (or nearest one within 10 km), each divided by distance (km)
Count of hazardous waste facilities (TSDFs and LQGs) within 5 km (or nearest within 10 km), each divided by distance (km)
Count of LUSTs (multiplied by a factor of 7.7) and the number of USTs within a 1,500-foot buffered block group
RSEI modeled toxic concentrations at stream segments within 500 meters, divided by distance in kilometers (km)
Number of Safe Drinking Water Act violations not returned to compliance (past 5 years)
Percent of individuals in a block group who list a racial status other than white alone and/or list their ethnicity as Hispanic or Latino.
Percent of a block group's population in households where the household income is less than or equal to twice the federal "poverty level."

Percent of a block group's population that did not have a job at all during the reporting period, made at least one effort to find a job during the prior 4 weeks, and were available for work (unless temporarily ill)
Percent of people in a block group living in limited English speaking households
Percent of people age 25 or older in a block group whose education is short of a high school diploma
Percent of people in a block group under the age of 5
Percent of people in a block group over the age of 64
Risk of flooding at any location
Flood Risk
Wildfire Risk
100-Year Floodplain
Sea Level Rise
Extreme Heat
Low Life Expectancy
Heart Disease
Asthma
Cancer
Person with Disabilities
Broadband Gaps
Lack of Health Insurance
Housing Burden
Transportation Access
Food Desert
